node.title: Israel: Gunman who killed 5 in third such recent attack was Palestinian
node.description: It came ahead of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan. The previous two attacks, carried out by Palestinian citizens of Israel inspired by ISIS, have raised concerns of further violence.

node.title: U.S., South Korea think Kim Jong Un faked test of "monster missile"
node.description: North Korea claimed to have fired a new long-range missile with worrying capabilities, but defense officials say it was really an ICBM last tested in 2017.

node.title: Body of missing tramper believed to be found - police
node.description: Police say that the body of a man, believed to be a tramper that went missing in Milford Sound on Monday, has been found.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 14 deaths, 15,918 cases, 817 in hospital
node.description: There have been 15,918 new cases of Covid-19 in the community and 14 more deaths reported today.

node.title: Ukraine war: Russia says it will curb Kyiv assault as peace talks progress
node.description: Russia has announced it will "drastically reduce" military combat operations in two key areas of Ukraine "to boost mutual trust" in peace talks

node.title: Gisborne housing situation 'dire', says advocate
node.description: A new report showing Gisborne leads the way in rental cost increases is no surprise to local housing advocates who have described an unworkable situation in Tairāwhiti.

node.title: Twenty fines to be issued over No 10 lockdown parties
node.description: Twenty fines will be issued as part of the police inquiry into Downing Street parties that broke Covid rules.

node.title: Turning wild plants into natural remedies
node.description: It doesn't take long for Rochana Moon to fill her wicker basket with wild plants and fungi. The medical herbalist and naturopath is foraging beside the Cardrona River in Central Otago. Audio

node.title: NZ's Russia sanctions: Retaliation may include cyber attacks, expert warns
node.description: A local cybersecurity expert says businesses need to prepare for attacks from Russian hackers.

node.title: LynnMall attacker was identified as capable of terrorism if travel plans thwarted
node.description: Security services briefings show the LynnMall attacker was highly likely to carry out a terrorist attack in New Zealand only if he was prevented from leaving the country.

node.title: Natural health industry says it could miss out on $500m in export earnings if legislation changes
node.description: The natural health industry says half a billion dollars in export earnings will be left on the table unless the government reverses a proposed legislative change.

node.title: Fog cancels flights in and out of Wellington Airport
node.description: Fog at Wellington Airport continues to force the cancellation of flights in and out of the capital.

node.title: Queen attends memorial service for Prince Philip
node.description: The Queen made her first public appearance in five months when she joined the royal family and other dignitaries at a memorial service for Prince Philip, who died last year.

node.title: Fog cancels flight in and out of Wellington Airport
node.description: Fog at Wellington Airport continues to force the cancellation of flights in and out of the capital.

node.title: Woman faults ANZ security after thieves strip her bank account
node.description: A Christchurch woman has been left reeling after thieves broke into her car and then used ATMs to steal thousands of dollars from her savings.

node.title: Container repair firm fined a second time for Tauranga Harbour pollution
node.description: Bay of Plenty Regional Council found sediment-laden storm water discharging from the company's site into the harbour twice in 2020, the court heard.

node.title: Pasifika at most risk of relaxed restrictions - Counties Manukau DHB member
node.description: The Pacific Island community will bear the burden of risks of lifting Covid-19 restrictions, says a Counties Manukau District Health Board member.

node.title: Two sailors killed in Pearl Harbor attack identified 80 years later
node.description: The two were identified as Navy Fire Controlman 2nd Class George Gilbert​ and Navy Seaman 1st Class Wilbur F. Newton​.

node.title: Open finance report urges legislative haste
node.description: The government expects to introduce the long-awaited consumer data right legislation by the end of the year.

node.title: Vaccination advice for employers updated
node.description: With changes to vaccination requirements coming next week, the government has published updated advice for employers.

node.title: Community now owns Britain's remotest mainland pub
node.description: A community in Lochaber has succeeded in its bid to buy Britain's remotest mainland pub in a landmark deal.

node.title: Consent sought for Franz protection
node.description: The West Coast Regional Council has applied to itself for resource consent for first phase works of a Government-funded $12.3 million project along the Waiho (Waiau) River to protect Franz Josef…

node.title: House Jan. 6 committee chair says gap in Trump phone log is "concerning"
node.description: CBS News and The Washington Post reported on a 7 ½-hour gap in Trump's phone log from Jan. 6, 2021, which included the period when rioting took place at the Capitol.

node.title: Tauihi Basketball Aotearoa will do so much for women's basketball
node.description: The new women's national basketball league will be known as Tauihi Basketball Aotearoa.

node.title: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis vetoes Congressional map in push for heavier GOP gerrymander
node.description: DeSantis cited issues with Florida's 5th Congressional district, a predominantly Black district in north Florida.

node.title: Counties Manukau DHB says service providers stuck in 'catch up' with child immunisation
node.description: Counties Manukau District Health Board says South Auckland healthcare providers appear to be caught in a "seemingly impossible catch-up phase" as they try to tackle declining child vaccination rates.

node.title: New Zealand and Fiji sign partnership agreement
node.description: The Fijian prime minister and New Zealand's foreign minister in Suva today signed the agreement promising "shared commitment and vision for regional solidarity".

node.title: Syft Technologies gains major new shareholder and capital
node.description: The Christchurch-based technology company has struck a deal to sell a near 20 percent stake to specialist a US private equity company for $22.8 million.

node.title: Rare spying case back before Court Martial for disclosure hearing
node.description: A Linton soldier charged with espionage is applying for a chance to argue access to highly-classified information held by the NZSIS.

node.title: FBI reopening cold case of young mom of 2 killed in 1994
node.description: Ault, who was 26 at the time of her death, was found dead on the floor of her Missouri home in January 1994.
